text: Paul Xavier Kelley (November 11, 1928 - December 29, 2019) was a United States Marine Corps general. He was the 28th Commandant of the United States Marine Corps from July 1, 1983, to June 30, 1987. In February 1980, Kelley was promoted to lieutenant general and named as the first Commander of the Rapid Deployment Joint Task Force. Kelley died on December 29, 2019 at a care facility in McLean, Virginia from Alzheimer's disease-related problems at the age of 91.Retired 28th Marine commandant Gen. Paul Kelley dies at 91 after 'lifetime of service' ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Virginia Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:American generals Category:People from Boston Category:Military people from Massachusetts
title: Paul X. Kelley
